About: Aloe vera is a succulent plant species native to the Arabian Peninsula but cultivated worldwide. It has thick, fleshy leaves that contain a gel-like substance known for its various medicinal properties.
Medicinal Benefits: The gel from aloe vera leaves is widely used to treat burns, wounds, and minor skin irritations due to its soothing and anti-inflammatory properties. It is also used topically to alleviate symptoms of skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis. Aloe vera juice is believed to improve digestion and promote gut health.

About: Lemon is a citrus fruit known for its tart flavor and bright yellow color. It is widely cultivated for its culinary and medicinal uses.
Medicinal Benefits: Lemons are rich in vitamin C, which is essential for boosting the immune system and fighting off colds and infections. Lemon juice is commonly used as a natural remedy for sore throat and cough. Drinking warm lemon water is believed to aid in digestion, detoxification, and weight loss.

About: Hibiscus is a flowering plant belonging to the mallow family (Malvaceae). It is cultivated for its vibrant flowers and used in various cuisines and herbal teas.
Medicinal Benefits: Hibiscus tea is rich in antioxidants and is known for its potential to lower blood pressure and cholesterol levels. It is also used to relieve menstrual cramps and promote kidney health. Topical application of hibiscus extract may help promote hair growth and improve skin health.

Scientific Name: Mentha spp. (Various species including Mentha piperita, Mentha spicata, etc.)
About: Mint is a perennial herb with a refreshing aroma and flavor. It is widely cultivated for culinary and medicinal purposes.
Medicinal Benefits: Mint leaves contain menthol, which has a cooling effect and is used to relieve indigestion, bloating, and nausea. Mint tea is known to have calming effects on the stomach and may alleviate symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). Inhalation of mint oil vapor can help relieve nasal congestion and headaches.

About: Kepala, also known as Indian Pennywort or Gotu Kola, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Asia. It has long been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
Medicinal Benefits: Kepala is traditionally used in Ayurvedic medicine to improve memory, cognitive function, and mental clarity. It is believed to have adaptogenic properties, helping the body adapt to stress and promoting overall well-being. Kepala is also used topically to promote wound healing, reduce inflammation, and improve skin conditions like psoriasis and eczema.
